Title Provide SRI tenant support for ongoing platform usage Value Statement As a BIP AI Tenant on the SRI team, I need the ability to receive timely support so that I can resolve issues and continue my work without unnecessary delays. Acceptance Criteria When a user from SRI requests support, the support team responds and assists as needed. Manual validation: Confirm support requests are tracked and resolved. Update deployment dates in Confluence for each support ticket
This issue is cloned by BIP-26552

Title Support TERA deployment to scale to production data size. Value Statement As a BIP AI Tenant (TERA) who is deploying a new version of code, I need the ability to receive deployment support and guidance so that I can implement fixes that enable scaling to production data size effectively.

Acceptance Criteria

When TERA initiates the deployment, the tenant team has access to technical support for deploying the new version of their code. When the deployment is complete, the fixes are validated to ensure they address scaling challenges for production data size. Validate successful deployment by confirming that the new version of TERA's code operates efficiently with production-scale data.

As a tenant I want to know what models are available to me

AC: Create documentation to list out what models can be imported onto the platform and any restrictions. Also, document use cases that would require custom models as opposed to Bedrocks native LLMs.

As a tenant I want to know what the cost of hosting our own model would be compared to Bedrock inference.

AC:

Add to confluence document detailed estimates of cost for each model size, including which instance sizes to use and uptime estimates.

As a bip ai engineer who is responsible for system health and deployment validation, I need to recreate the master health check pipeline so that it can reliably trigger and monitor the execution of multiple dependent Jenkins pipelines in a coordinated fashion.

items.from_string: As a bip ai engineer who is responsible for system health and deployment validation, I need to recreate the master health check pipeline so that it can reliably trigger and monitor the execution of multiple dependent Jenkins pipelines in a coordinated fashion.
items.to_string:
As a bip ai engineer who is responsible for system health and deployment validation, I need to recreate the master health check pipeline so that it can reliably trigger and monitor the execution of multiple dependent Jenkins pipelines in a coordinated fashion.

AC:

- When the master health check pipeline is triggered, it should sequentially or concurrently initiate all registered downstream pipelines. - When a downstream pipeline fails, the master pipeline should flag the failure and halt or continue based on configurable logic. - When all downstream pipelines succeed, the master pipeline should report an overall success status. - When viewing the master pipeline log, users should see a consolidated view of the status and output from each triggered pipeline. - When the pipeline is recreated, it should support parameterized execution (e.g., for environment selection or scope of checks).

Value Statement As a BIP AI cloud security engineer who manages security review of ARIA application, I need the ability to create a threat model for ARIA application so that security risk and mitigation strategy can be identified.

Acceptance Criteria

1 Create security model diagram for ARIA application.

2 Identify threat, impact and mitigation.

3 Document the recommendations in confluence.
This issue is cloned by BIP-26322

Value Statement As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I need an automated script to migrate crossplane resource ownership from existing mlmats app claims to new bip-ai claims, so that I can reduce human error, minimize downtime, and enable seamless migration of existing resources to new applications or namespaces without manual intervention.

Description The current process of migrating crossplane resources from the mlmats application to new bip-ai claims requires manual intervention and is prone to human error. This story involves developing an automated migration script that handles the complete lifecycle of transferring resource ownership, including pausing claims, updating ownership references, and coordinating with ArgoCD for resource pruning. The script will serve as a proof of concept for automated resource migration capabilities and establish a foundation for future infrastructure migrations between applications and namespaces.

Acceptance Criteria When I initiate a migration of resources from an existing mlmats claim to a new bip-ai claim, then the script needs to: Automatically pause the original claim to prevent conflicts during migration Identify and extract all ownership references from the original claim Create or verify the target claim exists and is in a paused state by default When I execute the ownership transfer process, then the script needs to: Copy all relevant ownership references from the original claim to the new claim Update the composite resource to reference the new claim as the owner Validate that the ownership transfer was successful before proceeding When I complete the migration process, then the script needs to: Remove ownership references from the original claim Enable ArgoCD to safely prune the old claim Provide comprehensive logging of all migration steps performed Handle rollback scenarios if migration fails at any step When I run the script in a local development environment, then it needs to: Be fully functional and able to handle end-to-end migration testing Provide clear feedback on migration status and any errors encountered Support dry-run mode to preview changes before execution Include validation checks to ensure target environment is ready for migration When I use the script for infrastructure management, then it needs to: Support migration between different applications and namespaces Maintain resource integrity throughout the migration process Provide audit trail of all changes made during migration Be idempotent to allow safe re-execution if needed Definition of Done Script is developed and tested in local environment All acceptance criteria are met and validated Documentation includes usage instructions and examples Error handling and logging are comprehensive Script passes integration tests with sample mlmats to bip-ai claim migrations

Title: Implement BIP-AI RBAC for tooling ArgoCD to allow management of applications

Value Statement As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I need to implement RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) for tooling ArgoCD, so that I can enable proper access management and security controls for application deployment and management within the BIP-AI platform. Description This story involves implementing comprehensive RBAC policies for the tooling ArgoCD instance to ensure proper access control, security boundaries, and operational governance for application management for BIP AI Infrastructure engineers. The implementation will follow security best practices and integrate with existing authentication and authorization systems.

A/C: When I implement RBAC policies for tooling ArgoCD, then I need to: Define appropriate roles and permissions for different user types (developers, operators, administrators) Configure RBAC policies that align with BIP-AI security requirements Implement proper access controls for application management operations Follow existing RBAC patterns and conventions used in the BIP platform When I configure the RBAC integration, then it needs to: Integrate with existing authentication systems (OIDC, SSO) Support fine-grained permissions for different environments (dev, staging, prod) Enable proper application lifecycle management controls Restrict access based on user roles and project boundaries When I test the RBAC implementation, then it needs to: Successfully authenticate and authorize users based on their roles Properly enforce permission boundaries for application operations Handle different user scenarios (create, read, update, delete applications) Work correctly in ephemeral environment for validation When I validate the RBAC functionality, then it needs to: Demonstrate proper access control enforcement Show correct permission inheritance and role mapping Handle edge cases and unauthorized access attempts appropriately Maintain audit trails for access and operations Definition of Done: RBAC policies implemented and configured for tooling ArgoCD Integration with authentication systems completed Comprehensive testing performed in ephemeral environment PR created with approvals from Engineering team Documentation updated with RBAC configuration and usage patterns
This issue is cloned by BIP-26582

Value Statement

As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I need to validate the claim migration script in the ephemeral cluster environment, so that I can ensure platform compatibility and prepare for production release with confidence. Description Before releasing the automated claim migration script to production environments, it must be thoroughly tested in the ephemeral cluster to validate functionality within the actual platform configuration and identify any environment-specific compatibility issues.

Acceptance Criteria

When I deploy the migration script to the ephemeral environment, then it needs to: Successfully execute without configuration errors Integrate properly with the platform's existing crossplane and ArgoCD setup Handle ephemeral cluster-specific networking and authentication requirements When I create test resources for migration validation, then I need to: Set up sample mlmats claims with associated resources in the ephemeral cluster Create corresponding target bip-ai claims for migration testing Verify test resources are properly configured and ready for migration When I execute migration tests in the ephemeral environment, then the script needs to: Successfully migrate test resources from mlmats to bip-ai claims Maintain resource integrity throughout the migration process Complete the full migration lifecycle including ArgoCD pruning of old claims When I document the test results, then I need to: Capture screenshots of successful migration processes Document any platform-specific modifications required for compatibility Provide evidence of before/after resource states Record performance metrics and execution times When the script encounters platform compatibility issues, then I need to: Identify and document specific configuration differences Implement necessary modifications for ephemeral environment compatibility Re-test after modifications to ensure functionality Definition of Done Migration script successfully executes in ephemeral cluster At least 3 test migrations completed with documented results Screenshots captured showing successful migration outcomes Any platform compatibility issues identified and resolved Test report created with recommendations for production deployment

Value Statement As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I need a function in the crossplane claimer that lists all Crossplane resources in a cluster, so that I can have comprehensive visibility into resource states and ownership for better infrastructure management.

Description The crossplane claimer currently has limited resource listing capabilities. This story involves developing or enhancing functionality to retrieve and display all Crossplane resources in a cluster with detailed metadata, improving operational visibility and supporting debugging workflows.

Acceptance Criteria When I evaluate the implementation approach, then I need to: Analyze existing list paused resources function for reusability Review the current 5-minute query function for potential extension Determine whether to modify existing function or create new function based on code duplication assessment Document recommended approach with justification When I implement the list all resources function, then it needs to: Return a dictionary of all Crossplane resources in the cluster Include resource name, ownership references, annotations, labels, plurals, apiVersion, and kind for each resource Support manual refresh capability from the front-end interface Handle cluster authentication and permissions appropriately When I test the function locally, then it needs to: Successfully retrieve and format resource data Handle edge cases like missing annotations or labels gracefully Provide consistent response structure across different resource types Execute within acceptable performance parameters When I test the function in SBX environment, then it needs to: Work with actual cluster configuration and permissions Return accurate data for real Crossplane resources Integrate properly with existing claimer functionality Maintain system stability during execution Definition of Done Implementation approach evaluated and documented Function developed and tested locally Function validated in SBX environment Code follows existing claimer patterns and standards Documentation updated with new function usage

As an Infrastructure engineer, I need to update the BIP AI Gateway UI to be 508 compliant, so that the gateway is in compliance with VA policy. 

A/C: The UI for every page on the AI gateway is evaluated and updated for accessibility to be tested by a 508 tester.
Make the gateway 508 compliant with VA policy

As an Infrastructure engineer I need to recreate the image promotion pipeline so that images can be promoted from one environment to another.

Acceptance Criteria (A/C): A Jenkins pipeline is created in the [ml-mats-infrastructure-pipelines](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/ml-mats-infrastructure-pipelines/tree/main/src) repository with the following parameters:

- source_repo
 * source_image
 * - source_tag
 * - target_repo
 * - target_image
 * - target_tag The pipeline must take the image from the source repository and move it to the target repository. The pipeline must be able to pull from and push to both Nexus and ECR repositories.

items.to_string:
As an Infrastructure engineer I need to recreate the image promotion pipeline so that images can be promoted from one environment to another.

Acceptance Criteria (A/C):

A Jenkins pipeline is created in the [ml-mats-infrastructure-pipelines]([https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/ml-mats-infrastructure-pipelines/tree/main/src]) repository with the following parameters:
 - source_repo

 * source_image
 * - source_tag
 * - target_repo
 * - target_image
 * - target_tag
 * The pipeline must take the image from the source repository and move it to the target repository. The pipeline must be able to pull from and push to both Nexus and ECR repositories.

Value Statement

As a BIP AI cloud security engineer who assisted test preparation for WASA assessment, I need the ability to set up Fortify scan in Jenkins to supplement the scan result from CodeQL so that all supported languages (both CodeQL and Fortify) are scanned.

Acceptance Criteria 1 Set up Fortify scan in Jenkins for the following repos: * https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-ai-services * https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-ai-chatbot * https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-ai-gateway * https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-tenant-api Notes: BIP AI is informed by IA team that MLMATS app repos contain non-scannable languages for CodeQL and will need to ensure Fortify is also enabled in Jenkins pipeline.

Value Statement

As a BIP AI engineer who builds and tests APIs, I need to create a reusable prompt library that guides Copilot to generate Bruno collections so that I can accelerate and standardize collection creation across projects.

Acceptance Criteria 
 When a user writes a prompt for a Bruno collection, the user has the ability to save it to a structured prompt library organized by request type (GET, POST, etc.). When a new endpoint needs testing, the user has the ability to reference and adapt an existing prompt from the library. When using the prompt, the user has the ability to receive valid Bruno request files from Copilot with structured tests included.
Impact: Enables rapid development of consistent, validated Bruno API collections across projects, saving hours of manual request and test generation.

Title Merge Renovatebot PRs in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, and bip mlops template repos for up-to-date dependencies

Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains platform resources, I need to merge Renovatebot pull requests in key repositories so that dependencies remain current and the codebase benefits from the latest updates and security patches.

Acceptance Criteria When a user reviews the repos, all open Renovatebot PRs in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, and bip mlops template are merged if they pass required checks. The codebase reflects updated dependencies after merging. Functionality that will validate that this story is complete: Manual review confirms all eligible Renovatebot PRs are merged and dependencies are up to date.

items.from_string: Merge renovatebot PRs in relevant repos
items.to_string: Merge Renovatebot PRs in relevant repos

Title Update dependencies to ensure Python 3.13 compatibility for tenant use. 
 
Value Statement As a BIP AI Tenant who uses the mlkit and tenant-resources repositories, I need the dependencies to be updated for compatibility with Python 3.13 so that I can continue developing and deploying models without compatibility issues. 
 
Acceptance Criteria When the dependencies in the mlkit and tenant-resources repositories are updated, they are compatible with Python 3.12 and 3.13. Ensure that all tests in both repositories pass successfully with Python 3.12 and 3.13. Validate that tenants can use the updated repositories and mlkit package without encountering compatibility errors. Provide documentation or release notes highlighting the changes and any necessary steps for tenants to upgrade.

items.to_string:
Title  Simplify and clean up tenant resources repo
 
Value Statement:
As a BIP AI Tenant who requires access to tutorials and templates, the tenant resources needs refactoring and clean up. The goal is to have a very friendly and beginner resource repository, where it is easy to follow along. 
 * identify things that need cleaning up, i.e. unclear or non-uniformed naming conventions (use of dashes vs underscores, SM vs sagemaker) 
- reorganize the folders and files that makes sense
 * refactor the below AC

 

 

 
Acceptance Criteria:
 - put quick_start at the root of notebooks/
 - update readme to explain what the folder structure and what is important for tenants
 - all data files should be in /data
 - anything under notebook should be .ipynb
 - anything under template should be a .py (remove the .ipynb templates, it looks like they are the same as the guides in notebooks? i.e. sm_deploy_template.ipynb)
 - identify any other duplicate or redundant notebooks or code

 - anything under template should be a .py (remove the .ipynb templates, it looks like they are the same as the guides in notebooks? i.e. sm_deploy_template.ipynb)
 - identify any other duplicate or redundant notebooks or code
 - add `example` or `tutorial` to notebooks that aren't identifying
 -
items.to_string:
Title  Simplify and clean up tenant resources repo
 
Value Statement:
As a BIP AI Tenant who requires access to tutorials and templates, the tenant resources needs refactoring and clean up. The goal is to have a very friendly and beginner resource repository, where it is easy to follow along. 
 * identify things that need cleaning up, i.e. unclear or non-uniformed naming conventions (use of dashes vs underscores, SM vs sagemaker) 

 - reorganize the folders and files that makes sense

 * refactor the below AC

 

 

 
Acceptance Criteria:
 - put quick_start at the root of notebooks/
 - update readme to explain what the folder structure and what is important for tenants
 - all data files should be in /data
 - anything under notebook should be .ipynb (unless required like the train.py file, I would just put trainer.py in the sm_train_guide.ipynb)
 - anything under template should be a .py (remove the .ipynb templates, it looks like they are the same as the guides in notebooks? i.e. sm_deploy_template.ipynb)
 - identify any other duplicate or redundant notebooks or code
 - add `example` or `tutorial` to notebooks that aren't identifying
 - fix any broken links in READMEs/notebooks

Title Create workflow diagrams to understand tenant Knowledge Base development process.

Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who provides support to tenants, I need workflow diagrams in Mural detailing the anticipated process tenants will use to develop Knowledge Bases in the dev environment so that I can better understand their workflows and provide effective support.

Acceptance Criteria When the workflow diagrams are created, they outline the key steps tenants will follow for Knowledge Base development, including setup, creation, testing, and deployment. The diagrams are created in Mural and are accessible to the internal team. Collaborate with Jorge and Jared to gather insights and ensure the diagrams reflect recent tenant experiences with Knowledge Base development. Validate the diagrams by reviewing them internally to confirm alignment with tenant needs and support goals.

items.from_string:

Title Create workflow diagrams to understand tenant Bedrock agent development process.

Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who provides support to tenants, I need workflow diagrams in Mural detailing the anticipated process tenants will use to develop Bedrock agents in the dev environment so that I can better understand their workflows and provide effective support.

Acceptance Criteria When the workflow diagrams are created, they outline the key steps tenants will follow for Bedrock agent development, including setup, development, testing, and deployment. The diagrams are created in Mural and are accessible to the internal team. Ensure the diagrams reflect the anticipated tenant workflows accurately and comprehensively. Validate the diagrams by reviewing them internally to confirm alignment with tenant needs and support goals.

Title Determine and set least privilege IAM permissions for Knowledge Base development to ensure secure tenant workflows.

Value Statement

As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports tenant development, I need the ability to determine and set least privilege IAM permissions for Bedrock Knowledge Base creation and development in the sandbox (SBX) and dev environments so that tenant workflows are secure and compliant with VA policies.

Acceptance Criteria When IAM permissions are determined, they follow the principle of least privilege and align with VA security requirements. Collaborate with Jorge and Jared to gather insights on Knowledge Base development needs and workflows. Work with the infrastructure team to implement IAM role updates for SBX and dev environments. Validate that tenants can create and develop Knowledge Bases with the updated IAM permissions without encountering access issues. Provide documentation of the updated IAM roles and permissions for internal reference.

items.from_id: Let's keep this ticket opened until Thursday just in case something else comes up.

Dev domains were redeployed twice. All 10 dev domains were validated successfully. The procedure to validate are as follows.
 # create the github secret
 # run the jenkins lcc attach pipeline.
 # create and run a space
 # clone the bip-ai mlkit repository
 # run the validation script

items.to_string:
Research and document top Gen AI frameworks to evaluate AWS Bedrock integration potential.

Value Statement

As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who plans platform enhancements, I need research and documentation on top Gen AI frameworks and their compatibility with AWS Bedrock so that I can evaluate integration options and plan next steps effectively.

Acceptance Criteria

When research is completed, it identifies the top Gen AI frameworks and their key features. Documentation is created in Confluence following the technical documentation template. The documentation includes an analysis of how each framework can integrate with AWS Bedrock, including potential benefits and challenges. Validate the documentation by reviewing it internally to ensure it provides actionable insights for planning integration. Provide recommendations or considerations for next steps based on the findings.

Title Add unit tests to improve code coverage based on audit findings.

Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains platform reliability, I need the ability to add unit tests to one of the areas identified in last sprint's audit so that the codebase is more robust and easier to maintain.

Acceptance Criteria When the specific repo and area requiring unit tests are identified (based on Julia’s audit), this ticket will be updated with the relevant details. Unit tests are added to cover the identified functionality and ensure proper validation of edge cases. All tests pass successfully in the Git Actions CI/CD pipeline. Validate that the new tests improve code coverage and reliability metrics.
This issue is cloned by BIP-26316

Title

Test custom image attachment to SageMaker Studio code editor to enable future GitHub Copilot support.

Value Statement

As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports tenant workflows, I need the ability to test the attachment of a custom image to SageMaker Studio code editor so that we can evaluate the feasibility of enabling the GitHub Copilot extension.

Acceptance Criteria

When the Dockerfile from the AWS documentation (second example on https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/dg/code-editor-custom-images.html) is built in Jenkins, it is successfully pushed to ECR. When the custom image is created and attached to SageMaker Studio, it is validated using the describe-domain and update-domain AWS CLI commands. Confirm that the custom image is functional and accessible in the SageMaker Studio code editor. Document the process and any issues encountered for future reference and next steps.

Title Research AWS Bedrock Guardrails to provide implementation guidance for tenants.

Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports tenant workflows, I need the ability to research AWS Bedrock Guardrails and document requirements, use cases, and recommendations so that tenants can implement appropriate guardrails to ensure secure and compliant AI/ML model development.

Acceptance Criteria When research is completed, it includes detailed information on AWS Bedrock Guardrails, including requirements, use cases, and best practices. Documentation is created in Confluence following the technical documentation template. Recommendations are tailored to tenant needs, focusing on security, compliance, and scalability. Provide references to relevant AWS documentation for further tenant exploration.

Title Investigate and resolve MLflow authentication issues to ensure tenant access.

Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports tenant workflows, I need the ability to address MLflow authentication issues and update tenant resources so that tenants can securely access and use their MLflow instances without disruptions.

Acceptance Criteria When MLflow authentication issues are investigated, the root cause is identified and documented. Coordinate with Chow to ensure updates are made to the tenant resources notebook and domain validation script to meet new authentication requirements. Validate that tenants can successfully authenticate and access their MLflow instances after the updates. Provide documentation of the changes made and any necessary steps for tenants to adapt to the updated authentication process.

Title Resolve SageMaker Pipelines scheduler error to enable tenant usage.

Value Statement As a BIP AI Tenant who uses SageMaker Pipelines, I need the ability to schedule pipeline executions without encountering errors so that I can automate workflows efficiently.

Acceptance Criteria When the "Failed to check schedule group class. Cannot create." error is resolved, tenants can successfully create and use the SageMaker Pipelines scheduler. Investigate the root cause of the error and implement a fix to make the scheduler functional. Validate the fix by testing the scheduler with the SRI tenant team and ensuring it works as expected. Provide documentation or guidance for tenants on how to use the scheduler feature. Confirm that the scheduler is available and operational for all tenants.
This issue is cloned by BIP-26321

As an MLE I want to be able to get tags from Bedrock resources so access can be limited

AC: Notebook created with function that will extract the tags including tenant from Bedrock resources

As an MLE I want to be able to display access to agents and Knowledge Bases using user token and resource tags

AC: Change the list agent and KB functions in the api to filter based on the user token

As an MLE I want to see if its possible to send user credentials to AWS to authenticate bedrock access

AC: Document with findings of if it's possible to do using AWS and Boto3

As an MLE I want to turn the github refresh notebook into a sagemaker pipeline so it can be scheduled

AC: Notebook creating a SageMaker pipeline with two steps:

1) Pull data from github and upload into s3

2) Kick off ingestion job that will refresh the Knowledge Base
This issue is cloned by BIP-26567

As an MLE, I want to create a generalized playbook on how to set up a Figma MCP

AC: Documentation created on generalized process to set up Figma MCP locally. Include Copilot integration, container needed (if any), and how to include BIP Content Library.

As an MLE, I want to better understand the existing use case of Figma's MCP use.

AC: Create full documentation on use case, how the demo was set up - including any configurations necessary.

As an MLE, I want to create a proof of concept example of using Figma MCP locally.

AC: Repo created with Figma starter file, notebook, and basic front end that can interact with Copilot.
BIP AI FY25Q4.2, BIP AI FY25Q4.3

As an MLE, I want to create a proof of concept example of using Playwright MCP locally.

AC: Repo created with basic Playwright workflow that can be triggered through Copilot.

items.from_string: CLONE - Update Screen Scraper with AI and Puppeteer to Collect Pricing Data Since Major Changes to the Bedrock Pricing Dynamic HTML
items.to_string: Implement manual pricing data updates for bedrock costing to provide interim cost tracking solution

items.from_string:
Value Statement
 * As a ML Engineer who calculates model invocation costs per 1000 input/output tokens from the Bedrock pricing web page, I need the ability to track Bedrock invocation costs from real-time/current model token pricing data so that I get accurate cost tracking and reporting to discern if users are over budget.

Acceptance Criteria
 * Develop and deploy a container running Node.js and Puppeteer to filter the dynamic HTML on 'AWS GovCloud'
 * Scrape the pricing data into the schema:

{code:java}
{
    "model_family": "Anthropic",
    "model_name": "Claude Sonnet 4",
    "price_per_1000_input_tokens": 0.003,
    "price_per_1000_output_tokens": 0.015
  }{code}
 * Version controlled pricing and model ID data is inserted into the PostgreSQL database from the Python API.
 * Documentation is updated here: Comments in Python code and high-level overview in README markdown document in the Git repository.
 * Automated or manual tests were added here: Automated integration tests.

Assumptions
None

Dependencies
 * None

Notes
 * Per our conversations with the client, the following information may be useful: The tenants will start using Bedrock model families other than Anthropic, including but limited to Meta Llama models.

Out of Scope
N/A
items.to_string:
*Description:* As a BIP AI platform team, we need to implement manual pricing data updates for the bedrock costing application to provide accurate cost tracking for our tenants while we develop a more robust programmatic solution. The current web scraping approach for AWS Bedrock pricing is unreliable due to frequent changes in AWS pricing page formats, causing delays in providing cost data to tenants who depend on this information for budget planning and usage monitoring.
*Value Statement:* This interim solution will enable us to quickly provide semi-accurate pricing data to tenants, ensuring business continuity for cost tracking while we invest time in developing a more sustainable long-term pricing solution. This approach reduces development overhead and allows us to maintain service reliability.
*Acceptance Criteria:* * *Given* the bedrock costing lambda is invoked, *when* it processes pricing data, *then* it should bypass the existing web scraping functionality and use manual pricing data stored in the database
 * *Given* recent GovCloud pricing data is available from AWS pricing pages, *when* the database is updated with manual pricing data, *then* it should contain current pricing for Amazon and Anthropic models filtered for GovCloud regions
 * *Given* manual pricing data needs to be deployed across environments, *when* database updates are required, *then* they should be packaged as SQL scripts located in the {{postgres-schema}} directory to simplify deployment to upper environments
 * *Given* the updated lambda code is deployed, *when* tested in SBX environment, *then* it should successfully calculate costs using the manual pricing data without attempting web scraping

*Technical Implementation Notes:* * Update lambda function in [lambda|vscode-file://vscode-app/Applications/Visual%20Studio%20Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-sandbox/workbench/workbench.html] to bypass [get_price_list()|vscode-file://vscode-app/Applications/Visual%20Studio%20Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-sandbox/workbench/workbench.html] web scraping
 * Create new SQL script in [postgres-schema|vscode-file://vscode-app/Applications/Visual%20Studio%20Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-sandbox/workbench/workbench.html] for manual pricing data insertion
 * Pricing data should be sourced from AWS pricing pages with GovCloud filter applied for Amazon and Anthropic models
 * Maintain existing database schema and cost calculation logic

items.from_string:
*Value Statement:*
As a BIP AI tenant who develops models in SageMaker, I need the ability to integrate and utilize custom logging from the BIP AI library, MLKit, so that I can monitor and troubleshoot model events effectively across the lifecycle.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
When a user runs any stage of the SageMaker Model Lifecycle notebook (e.g., training, registration, deployment), the user has the ability to capture standardized logs using the BIP AI team's logger from MLKit.
items.to_string:
*Value Statement:*
As a BIP AI tenant who runs workflows in SageMaker, I need the ability to securely retrieve configuration parameters and secrets from managed services so that I can avoid hardcoding values and protect sensitive information during model development and deployment.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
When a user runs any part of the SageMaker Model Lifecycle notebook, the user has the ability to retrieve parameters from AWS Systems Management Parameter Store and secrets from AWS Secrets Manager securely.
